data.title: Great flavors!!
data.text: Their flavors of balsamic oils are great. Dipping in bread. So delicious. A little high on cost. Could be a dollar cheaper.

data.title: Olive Oil & More
data.text: Great place for a "local" gift! They also have an oil tasting room and fresh bread!! I love their chapstick too.

data.title: A Must Stop
data.text: The Temecula Olive Oil Company is a really neat place to stop not only for tourists but for locals too!  They have amazing olive oils, vinegars, olives, spices and spreads.  We love heir tasting room because you can actually try it before you buy it!  It's not only great or personal use, but also makes really great gifts!!  Stop by, you won't be sorry!

data.title: Olive Oils and nice store
data.text: If you are looking for a Temecula souvenir, you cant go wrong with local olive oil.  Cute store and nice location in Old town.

data.title: Delious
data.text: Great olive oil and balsamic vinegar tasting. And you may order some freshed baked bread. Yes right out of the onion.

data.title: OLIVE OYL, NO POPEYE
data.text: A small shop located in Old Town Temecula. Purveyors of Oils, Soaps, Lip Balm, Vinegars and other items. There is a tasting counter where you can taste the oils/vinegar. Prices are a little steep though. If you cant get to Corning for the Olive Pit this is an option.

data.title: So Much Goodness Packed into a Small Store
data.text:
Located in Old Town Temecula, my Mother and I come by here every time I come visit her from Omaha. What brought us in was the complementary tastings of their farm-made Oils and Vinegars, as well as to stock-up for my trip home. 

When we entered, we were greeted by an employee behind the register. We told her we were interested in trying the olive oil and she told us to head to the next room where someone can take care of us.
 At first my Mother asked if we should buy some crusty french bread (they sell a few different types of bread by the register), but the employee told us that the olive oil is actually best tasted as is. She said it can be sipped directly. She said that often times the bread will change some of the nature flavors of the oil, so She suggested we try the tasting first and if we still want to get some bread, then we can come back, get some and try all of them again. So we decided to head to the tasting room where we were greeted by an employee who helped us try a few different types of oils. 
Now just to let you know, you are able to taste as many of their oils and balsamic vinegars as you like and are not pressured to buy any (but most people seem to purchase something). After trying several different oils and vinegars (and a combination of them), we ended up purchasing:

Roasted Garlic Extra Virgin Olive Oil ($20.99 per bottle)- This olive oil is incredibly delicious and is only available just after the pressing, twice a year and it sells out fast. You can really taste that roasted garlic. The olive oil itself really is thin so that you can drink it directly (like a wine tasting). I can see making delicious sauces and dressings in the future with this (or just enjoying it with a little bit of bread by itself isn't a bad idea either).
Overall, service was very friendly. Granted these oils and vinegars are not cheap, but the prices seem to be comparable to other olive oil stores that we have gone to before. I definitely would come back to purchase more oils and vinegars in the future. (By the way, a set of oil and vinegar would make an excellent hostess gift). 
I CANNOT visit my Mother in Sun City, CA without the 20 minute drive to Temecula, just to bring some Temecula Olive Oils, Flavored Vinegars, Specialty Salts, Olive Tapenades, unique gift items (such as the Green Olive Leaf shaped Pasta) and Bruschetta home for my family and friends....

data.title: Olive Oil Tastings!
data.text: We came across this place while walking around Old Town. They do olive oil and vinegar tastings. They were so delicious we purchased and shipped home 6 bottles. The woman was very patient with us as we tried many olive oils and vinegar. They will do free shipping on purchases over $100. They have a small amount of fresh bread, but otherwise it's mostly a tasting room and gift store. They have many products made of olive oil such as soaps and other beauty products.

data.title: Quaint and mostly friendly
data.text: Stopped by to grab some bottles of olive oil as gifts. The lady who gave us the oil tasting was great. But the young guy at the register should acknowledge customers, smile and say thank you. I think he was peeved because I asked to bag the bottles in separate bags. Sour the otherwise a great experience.

data.title: Delicious Olive Oils and Balsamic!
data.text:
What a great little store with olive oil treasures!
Nick was the best sales and gift wrapper ever and because he took time to help me it made the delicious experience more enjoyable:)

data.title: GREAT STORE AND OLIVE-OIL EXPERIENCE
data.text: They not only have olive-oil tasting, but also many olive-oil products.  My husband says their shaving cream is the BEST!

data.title: "Oils in Old Town"
data.text: A tiny shop in Old Town Temecula is well worth a stop.  It's right on the corner near the Old Town Community Theater, so you can't miss it.  They make MANY products from their delicious olive oil, including the fabulous "Just Dip It" gourmet dipping oil vinegar, and olive oil soaps made with raspberries and many other flavors.  They are nicely packaged, so make great and unique gifts.

data.title: Olive oil tasting with wife
data.text: If you love olive oil, love to cook and have a willingness to explore new taste sensations, then this is the place to go.   They offer a variety of olive oils products with wonderful blends, i.e.  honey, pomegranate, orange, hickory, which are all so wonderful that you will have to bring home at least a couple of bottles for bar-be-cues, salads, and dessert toppings.

data.title: We have been patrons for YEARS! Unfortunately,we don't get enough time to enjoy!
data.text: Highly recommended as part of your visit to Temecula Old Town. We have been patrons since the 80's and will shop till we drop every time we are there. Let the knowledgeable staff indulge you in a tasting, then take home the booty. Highly recommended.

data.title: Great Products!
data.text: This is a great shop to visit.  They have a huge variety of plain olive oil, flavoured oils and other products.  My friend and I did the tasting and I wish I could remember the guy's name because he was excellent.  He went through all the oils and gave recipes for each of the oils. He was a walking cookbook and at the end we bought a few oils to try our own recipes at home. Friendly staff and worth a stop when going to Old Temecula.

data.title: Good stuff!
data.text:
We just happened upon this shop in Temecula.  Did a tasting and were amazed by the yummy oils and bath products.  I bought several bottles of their oils but my favorite it the lemon infused.  Absolutely delicious on fish.
Also am enjoying their soaps.

data.title: They offer very tasty olive oil and vinegar.
data.text:
They offer olive oil and vinegar tasting so you know what you want to take home! But they don't offer spreads and other stuff to try.. :(

Over all, the little shop has many different things other than oil and vinegar! A bit pricey tho..

data.title: The best
data.text: Give to clients for thank you gifts.  Excellent   Tried competitors and they do not compare.  Cute store in old town Temecula.

data.title: Tasty oils and local olive oil products
data.text: My first time to TOOC was great.  I was a new Temeculan and they were welcoming and very informative about the products, the process of creating everything, and the local ranch.  I am now a "member" and get quarterly products which I enjoy, because I use a ton of olive oil in cooking.  It is also a nice place to get gifts for people and give them a sampling of our local flavor.  Prices are a bit high for a bottle of oil.  Sometimes the counter service at the registers is a little gruff and for some reason they can never find my information in their system and have to look for me, but that's not your problem, as a reader.  It is their system.  Not a big deal.  Olive oil tasting is fun and I recommend it before you hit up the wineries; put a little oil in your stomach to break up the alcohol!

data.title: Family Vacation for Six!
data.text:
FAVORITE SPOT!  We came to Temecula for an adult family vacation with our grown children. Both our sons work in the restaurant business as well as their girlfriends. My father was a Master Chef and had dozens of restaurants during his life.  So, we were very interested to try this.  Color us IMPRESSED!!! WELL DONE! 
The barista clearly knew her oils and olives and we all enjoyed the tasting so much as well as her educating us all on some wonderful ways to blend and mix the flavors. 
We all purchased olive oil and special blends as well as some delicious bread and even some spices!  We will be back for sure.
I also really appreciated that the tasting bar was free of charge - everything seems to cost a ticket to try a sip - and when you are treating six people it gets expensive. This allowed us to get everyone something and then they all spent a bit more! 
FABULOUS SPOT!
